unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever felt like your regular multiplex isn't cutting it anymore? Like you're craving something more than the usual Friday release? Then you, my friend, need to dive headfirst into the wild and wonderful world of film festivals!
normalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Are More Than Just Movie Screenings

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a giant, week-long (or longer!) celebration of cinema. They're popping up all over the place, from the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa – happening every November- to smaller, niche festivals focused on documentaries, short films, or even regional cinema.

unnormalised: So, why should you ditch your comfy couch and brave the crowds? Well, for starters, you get to see movies you *won't* find anywhere else. We're talking indie gems, experimental flicks, and international masterpieces that might never make it to your local PVR. Imagine discovering the next Anurag Kashyap before everyone else!

unnormalised: Beyond the movies, festivals are a fantastic place to network. You might bump into aspiring filmmakers, seasoned directors, or even your favourite actor while grabbing a chai between screenings. Plus, many festivals offer workshops, Q&As with filmmakers, and panel discussions, giving you a deeper understanding of the art form.
